text.0: befriend us with their aids indra and agni indra and varuṇa who receive oblations.
text.1: indra and soma give health strength and comfort indra and pūṣan be our help in battle.
text.2: auspicious friends to us be bhaga sathsa auspicious be purandhi aid all riches.
text.3: the blessing of the true and wellconducted and aryaman in many forms apparent.
text.4: kind unto us he maker and sustainer and the farreaching pair with godlike natures.
text.5: auspicious unto us be earth and heaven the mountain and the gods fair invocations.
text.6: favour us agni with his face of splendour and varuva and mitra and the aśvins.
text.7: favour us noble actions of the pious impetuous vita blow on us with favour.
text.8: early invoked may heaven and earth be friendly and airs midregion good for us to look on.
text.9: to us may herbs and foresttrees be gracious gracious the lord victorious of the region.
text.10: be the god indra with the vasus friendly and with Ādityas varuṇa who blesseth.
text.11: kind with the rudras be the healer rudra and with the dames may tvaṣṭar kindly listen.
text.12: blest unto us be soma and devotions blest be the sacrifice the stones for pressing.
text.13: blest be the fixing of the sacred pillars blest be the tender grass and blest the altar.
text.14: may the farseeing sun rise up to bless us be the four quarters of the sky auspicious.
text.15: auspicious be the firmlyseated mountains auspicious be the rivers and the waters.
text.16: may adid through holy works be gracioas and may the maruts loud in song be friendly.
text.17: may viṣṇu give felicity and pūṣan the air that cherisheth our life and vāyu.
text.18: prosper us savitar the god who rescues and let the radiant mornings be propitious.
text.19: auspicious to all creatures be parjanya auspicious be the fields benign protector.
text.20: may all the fellowship of gods befriend us sarasvatī with holy thoughts be gracious.
text.21: friendly be they the liberal ones who seek us yea those who dwell in heaven on earth in waters.
text.22: may the great lords of truth protect and aid us blest to us be our horses and our cattle.
text.23: kind be the pious skilfulhanded Ṛbhus kind be the fathers at our invocations.
text.24: may ajaekapād the god be gracious gracious the dragon of the deep and ocean.
text.25: gracious be he the swelling child of waters gracious be pṛśni who hath gods to guard her.
text.26: so may the rudras vasus and Ādityas accept the new hymn which we now are making.
text.27: may all the holy ones of earth and heaven and the cows offipring hear our invocation.
text.28: they who of holy gods are very holy immortal knowing law whom man must worship.
text.29: may these today give us broad paths to travel preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
